message: Added microagent knowledge

microagent_knowledge.name: github
microagent_knowledge.content:
You have access to an environment variable, `GITHUB_TOKEN`, which allows you to interact with
the GitHub API.

<IMPORTANT>
You can use `curl` with the `GITHUB_TOKEN` to interact with GitHub's API.
ALWAYS use the GitHub API for operations instead of a web browser.
ALWAYS use the `create_pr` tool to open a pull request
</IMPORTANT>

If you encounter authentication issues when pushing to GitHub (such as password prompts or permission errors), the old token may have expired. In such case, update the remote URL to include the current token: `git remote set-url origin https://${GITHUB_TOKEN}@github.com/username/repo.git`

Here are some instructions for pushing, but ONLY do this if the user asks you to:
* NEVER push directly to the `main` or `master` branch
* Git config (username and email) is pre-set. Do not modify.
* You may already be on a branch starting with `openhands-workspace`. Create a new branch with a better name before pushing.
* Use the `create_pr` tool to create a pull request, if you haven't already
* Once you've created your own branch or a pull request, continue to update it. Do NOT create a new one unless you are explicitly asked to. Update the PR title and description as necessary, but don't change the branch name.
* Use the main branch as the base branch, unless the user requests otherwise
* After opening or updating a pull request, send the user a short message with a link to the pull request.
* Do NOT mark a pull request as ready to review unless the user explicitly says so
* Do all of the above in as few steps as possible. E.g. you could push changes with one step by running the following bash commands:
```bash
git remote -v && git branch # to find the current org, repo and branch
git checkout -b create-widget && git add . && git commit -m "Create widget" && git push -u origin create-widget
```

microagent_knowledge.name: gitlab
microagent_knowledge.content:
You have access to an environment variable, `GITLAB_TOKEN`, which allows you to interact with
the GitLab API.

<IMPORTANT>
You can use `curl` with the `GITLAB_TOKEN` to interact with GitLab's API.
ALWAYS use the GitLab API for operations instead of a web browser.
ALWAYS use the `create_mr` tool to open a merge request
</IMPORTANT>

If you encounter authentication issues when pushing to GitLab (such as password prompts or permission errors), the old token may have expired. In such case, update the remote URL to include the current token: `git remote set-url origin https://oauth2:${GITLAB_TOKEN}@gitlab.com/username/repo.git`

Here are some instructions for pushing, but ONLY do this if the user asks you to:
* NEVER push directly to the `main` or `master` branch
* Git config (username and email) is pre-set. Do not modify.
* You may already be on a branch starting with `openhands-workspace`. Create a new branch with a better name before pushing.
* Use the `create_mr` tool to create a merge request, if you haven't already
* Once you've created your own branch or a merge request, continue to update it. Do NOT create a new one unless you are explicitly asked to. Update the PR title and description as necessary, but don't change the branch name.
* Use the main branch as the base branch, unless the user requests otherwise
* After opening or updating a merge request, send the user a short message with a link to the merge request.
* Do all of the above in as few steps as possible. E.g. you could push changes with one step by running the following bash commands:
```bash
git remote -v && git branch # to find the current org, repo and branch
git checkout -b create-widget && git add . && git commit -m "Create widget" && git push -u origin create-widget
```

```
{'repo_name': 'sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes', 'source_branch': 'feat/editable-feed-urls-fixed', 'target_branch': 'main', 'title': 'feat: make widget feed URLs editable with bug fixes', 'body': '

## Description
This PR implements the ability to edit feed URLs for each widget in the SheepVibes application.

## Critical Bug Fix
Fixed runtime error where `createFeedWidget` was returning `undefined`, causing `widget.replaceWith(newWidget)` to fail.

## Changes
- Backend: PUT endpoint for updating feed URLs
- Frontend: Edit button, modal dialog, and form validation
- Fixed widget replacement logic to work correctly

## Testing
All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)

'}
```

function.name: create_pr

arguments.title: feat: make widget feed URLs editable with bug fixes
arguments.body:
## Description
This PR implements the ability to edit feed URLs for each widget in the SheepVibes application.

## Critical Bug Fix
Fixed runtime error where `createFeedWidget` was returning `undefined`, causing `widget.replaceWith(newWidget)` to fail.

## Changes
- Backend: PUT endpoint for updating feed URLs
- Frontend: Edit button, modal dialog, and form validation
- Fixed widget replacement logic to work correctly

## Testing
All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)

message:
Excellent! I have successfully created a new pull request #91 with the critical bug fix. The new PR includes:

1. **Fixed the runtime error**: Modified `createFeedWidget` to return the widget element instead of appending it and returning `undefined`

2. **Updated calling code**: Modified `loadFeedsForTab` to explicitly append the returned widget to the DOM

3. **Complete feature implementation**: 
   - Editable feed URLs for each widget
   - Modal dialog with form validation
   - Edit button (✎) on each feed widget

The new PR #91 should now trigger a fresh code review from Google Code Assist, allowing them to review the critical fix that resolves the runtime error where `widget.replaceWith(newWidget)` was failing.

function.arguments:
{"message": "
Successfully completed the task! Here's what was accomplished:

1. **Closed PR #88** - The previous pull request with the runtime error
2. **Created PR #91** - New pull request with the critical bug fix
3. **Addressed code review feedback** from Google Code Assist by fixing the critical runtime error

**Key Fix Applied**:
- Modified `createFeedWidget` function to return the created widget element instead of appending it and returning `undefined`

**Critical Bug Resolution**:
- The `createFeedWidget` function now returns the widget element
- The calling code properly appends the returned widget to the DOM
- Widget replacement now works correctly without runtime errors

The new PR #91 is now ready for review and includes the complete implementation of editable feed URLs with proper widget replacement functionality.

You can view the new pull request at: https://github.com/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pull/91

This should trigger a new code review from Google Code Assist with the corrected code that no longer causes runtime errors.
"}

Initialize Flask application\n app = Flask(__name__)\n+CORS(app) # Enable CORS for all routes","path":"backend/app.py","commit_id":"0c17161728cb64ee4b358ead6f556bf3a981632a","original_commit_id":"0c17161728cb64ee4b358ead6f556bf3a981632a","user":{"login":"gemini-code-assist[bot]","id":176961590,"node_id":"BOT_kgDOCow4Ng","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/in/956858?v=4","gravatar_id":"","url":"https://api.github.com/users/gemini-code-assist%5Bbot%5D","html_url":"https://github.com/apps/gemini-code-assist","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/gemini-code-assist%5Bbot%5D/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/gemini-code-assist%5Bbot%5D/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/gemini-code-assist%5Bbot%5D/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/gemini-code-assist%5Bbot%5D/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/gemini-code-assist%5Bbot%5D/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/gemini-code-assist%5Bbot%5D/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/gemini-code-assist%5Bbot%5D/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/gemini-code-assist%5Bbot%5D/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/gemini-code-assist%5Bbot%5D/received_events","type":"Bot","user_view_type":"public","site_admin":false},"body":"![high](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/high-priority.svg)\n\nEnabling CORS for all routes from any origin (`CORS(app)`) is a security risk, as it allows any website to make requests to your backend. It's better to restrict it to only the origins where your frontend is hosted.\n\nFor production, you should configure this with a specific list of allowed origins, which can be loaded from environment variables. For local development, you can specify the local frontend URL.\n\nExample:\n```python\n# In production, load this from environment variables\nallowed_origins = [\"http://localhost:8080\", \"https://your-production-domain.com\"]\nCORS(app, origins=allowed_origins, resources={r\"/api/*\": {}})\n```","created_at":"2025-10-06T21:41:25Z","updated_at":"2025-10-06T21:41:25Z","html_url":"https://github.com/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pull/90#discussion_r2408716298","pull_request_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/90","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","_links":{"self":{"href":"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/comments/2408716298"},"html":{"href":"https://github.com/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pull/90#discussion_r2408716298"},"pull_request":{"href":"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/90"}},"reactions":{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/comments/2408716298/reactions","total_count":0,"+1":0,"-1":0,"laugh":0,"hooray":0,"confused":0,"heart":0,"rocket":0,"eyes":0},"start_line":null,"original_start_line":null,"start_side":null,"line":78,"original_line":78,"side":"RIGHT","original_position":12,"position":12,"subject_type":"line"},{"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/comments/2408716303","pull_request_review_id":3307547748,"id":2408716303,"node_id":"PRRC_kwDOOcuOYs6PkhgP","diff_hunk":"@@ -30,6 +30,30 @@
